meanings.definition: Not having a solid foundation or basis.
meanings.sent1: The wobbly table was unground and shaky.
meanings.sent2: The house built on sand was unground and unstable.
meanings.sent3: The unground argument fell apart easily.
meanings.sent4: Her unground beliefs crumbled under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The unground floor collapsed with a loud crash.

meanings.definition: Not having been subjected to grounding or punishment.
meanings.sent2: The unground student kept breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The unground puppy ran wild in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her unground actions led to consequences.
meanings.sent5: The unground teenager ignored all warnings.

meanings.definition: Not having been processed into a fine powder or paste.
meanings.sent1: The unground coffee beans smelled amazing.
meanings.sent2: The unground spices added a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent3: The unground flour made the cake dense.
meanings.sent4: Her unground herbs gave the dish a fresh taste.
meanings.sent5: The unground pepper added a kick to the soup.
